Code CDPWEB, (CDPTA, CDPTE)
) This IRM section provides an overview of the CDPWEB, (CDPTA, Command Codes. and (
) Purpose These section provides instructions for inputting and researching Collection Due Processing Tracking System. (
) Audience: These instructions are intended for campus tax examiners in Automated Collection System Support (ACSS). (
) Policy Owne
irector, Collection Policy, SBSE. (
) Program Owner SBSE Collection Policy, Employment Tax. (
) Primary Stakeholder
ampus operations ACS Support. (
) Program Goal
rocedures for using the CDP tracking system is in Liability Collection - Collection Appeal Rights (
) A Collection-Due-Tracking-Record is added to a module on IDRS Form
is ﬁled with the Service. (

) As a case proceeds through the various stages, information about that and when it occurred is recorded in IDRS using the Collection Due Tracking System (CDPTS) Website that utilize Command Codes CDPTR and CDPTE. (
) Stages entered in error may be deleted and incorrect information entered on a stage may be corrected. (
) CDPTS allows the user to retrieve and then inquire on all pertinent case mation from IDRS and review the whole case using CC CDPTA. with (
) CDPTS allows the user to input, update, and delete a whole case using CDPTE. See the delete portion of this document. (
) CC CDPTE may only be entered using web pages on the Collection Due Process Tracking System (CDPTS) Website of the Intranet Site HTTP// cdp.web.irs.gov. (

) The Collection Due Process Tracking System (CDPTS) is available for access through the HTTP://cdp.web.irs.gov Intranet website, only after workstation has been conﬁgured for WEB access and then only after a IDRS Sign On. See Exhibit
) Upon successful Sign On to the CDPTS, the user is presented with a set menu options: See Exhibit

a. Access Cases (to Select a Case or Cases for Review) b. View Reports (allows user to generate CDPTS Reports) c. IDRS CC (allows user to perform certain IDRS Command Codes TXMODA, SUMRY, IMFOLI, ENMOD, BMFOLI, TXMODS, CFINK) d. Print Screen (allows user to print current screen) e. Help (view CDPTS online IRMs) f. CDPTS Sign Off (to Sign Out of IDRS and this CDPTS Session) (
) If Access Cases menu item is clicked, the CDP Case Inquiry page is displayed that allows entry of a Taxpayer’s TIN See Exhibit
) Internal Revenue Manual
Code CDPWEB, (CDPTA, CDPTE) 2.3.79
CDPTS allows the user to retrieve and then inquire on all pertinent case infor- mation from IDRS and review the whole case using CC CDPTA. with deﬁner S
If Access Cases menu item is clicked, the CDP Case Inquiry page is displayed that allows entry of a Taxpayer’s TIN See Exhibit 2.3.79-3. .

IDRS Terminal • If the Taxpayers TIN is not found in the CDPTS, a message box will display notifying the user that the no data was not found on the TIF, When the user clicks OK, a message box will ask the user if a new case should be created See Exhibit
. If the user selects OK, the Stage
Receipt of Hearing Request web page is displayed with the TIN ﬁeld already ﬁlled with the previously entered TIN See Exhibit
• If the Taxpayers TIN is located in the CDPTS, all cases for the will be listed on the Case Listing Page. See Exhibit

. New Cases can be initiated using the Add A New Case Button on the Case Listing Page • The Case Listing page contains hyperlinks to the individual cases, When a hyperlink is clicked the user is presented with the Case Page See Exhibit
which lists all Stages associated with the Case. Each Stage on the list is a hyperlink to the associated Stage Page. New Stages can be added using the Add A New Stage Button the Case Detail Page. (
) If View Reports menu item is clicked, the system will present the CDPTS Reporting Group Access Page. See Exhibit
. The user enters Reporting Group and the Access Code and click the Continue Button. This present the CDPTS Report Builder Page See Exhibit
which provides a pre-deﬁned ﬁltered view of locations that the user can generate reports on. (
) If IDRS CC menu item is selected, the user is presented with the IDRS Command Code entry page. See Exhibit
) If Help menu item is selected, the user is presented wit
DP Web - IRM page See Exhibit
) If Sign Off menu item is selected, the Prompt for SIGN OFF appears and User is Logged off of IDRS. See Exhibit

) CDPTS inputs, validates and stores data about the progress of the case through the Collection Due Process. It records the stages a case reaches as well as comments about the case as it progresses. In addition, if a stage is changed or deleted, CDPTS marks it as such. (
) The occasion for each stage and the optional or required input ﬁelds may be found in the remaining sections of this IRM.
2.3 IDRS Terminal Responses

If the Taxpayers TIN is not found in the CDPTS, a message box will display notifying the user that the no data was not found on the TIF, When the user clicks OK, a message box will ask the user if a new case should be created See Exhibit
. If the user selects OK, the Stage
Receipt of Hearing Request web page is displayed with the TIN ﬁeld already ﬁlled with the previously entered TIN See Exhibit
If the Taxpayers TIN is located in the CDPTS, all cases for the will be listed on the Case Listing Page. See Exhibit

. New Cases can be initiated using the Add A New Case Button on the Case Listing Page The Case Listing page contains hyperlinks to the individual cases, When a hyperlink is clicked the user is presented with the Case Detail Page See Exhibit
which lists all Stages associated with the Case. Each Stage on the list is a hyperlink to the associated Stage Page. New Stages can be added using the Add A New Stage Button the Case Detail Page.
the Case Detail Page. (
) If View Reports menu item is clicked, the system will present the CDPTS Reporting Group Access Page. See Exhibit
. The user enters the Reporting Group and the Access Code and click the Continue Button. This present the CDPTS Report Builder Page See Exhibit
which provides a pre-deﬁned ﬁltered view of locations that the user can generate reports on. (
) If IDRS CC menu item is selected, the user is presented with the IDRS Command Code entry page. See Exhibit
) If Help menu item is selected, the user is presented wit
DP Web - IRM page See Exhibit
) If Sign Off menu item is selected, the Prompt for SIGN OFF appears and the User is Logged off of IDRS. See Exhibit

) CDPTS inputs, validates and stores data about the progress of the case through the Collection Due Process. It records the stages a case reaches as well as comments about the case as it progresses. In addition, if a stage is changed or deleted, CDPTS marks it as such. (
) The occasion for each stage and the optional or required input ﬁelds may be found in the remaining sections of this IRM.

. The user enters the Reporting Group and the Access Code and click the Continue Button. This will present the CDPTS Report Builder Page See Exhibit
which provides a pre-deﬁned ﬁltered view of locations that the user can generate reports on.
Sign Off menu item is selected, the Prompt for SIGN OFF appears and is Logged off of IDRS. See Exhibit 2.3.79-27.

Row Column Stage 01 Valid Form 12153 has been received. Cases are added to the CDPTS at Stage 1, Hearing Request Received. This is the only required stage. A stage 01 is required for each tax period that is part of the hearing request. Tin, MFT, Tax Period, Taxpayer Type, CDP Request No. have the same allowable values for all stages. It is now allowable to have multiple hearing requests of the same Hearing Type, MFT, Tax Period, and Stage 01 Date if the Taxpayer Type is T (Partner) and the Secondary TIN is different. • The case must have an existing stage
• The case must have a Hearing type of DP or EH • The stage
for the case must have an MFT of
• The MFT
for the case must also exist on IDRS for the Mirror to work

Stage 03 Form 12153 has been transferred to another Office. Stage Date must be entered. It must not be prior to the previous stage. Stage 01 must have been entered previously.
